meanings.definition: A loop made in a rope by means of a slipknot.
meanings.sent1: He carefully tied a snoose in the rope to secure it.
meanings.sent2: The snoose in the rope made it easy to hang the lantern.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel got its tail caught in the snoose.
meanings.sent4: Her fingers moved swiftly, creating a perfect snoose in the cord.
meanings.sent5: The cowboy expertly crafted a snoose to lasso the runaway calf.

meanings.definition: To catch or hold with a snare.
meanings.sent1: The hunter tried to snoose the rabbit in the forest.
meanings.sent2: She managed to snoose the fish with her clever trap.
meanings.sent3: The sneaky fox attempted to snoose the chickens in the coop.
meanings.sent4: The spider snoosed the unsuspecting fly in its web.
meanings.sent5: He hoped to snoose the elusive butterfly with his net.

meanings.definition: To catch or hold as if with a snare.
meanings.sent1: The detective tried to snoose the criminal before he escaped.
meanings.sent2: She snoosed his attention with her captivating story.
meanings.sent3: The magician managed to snoose the audience with his tricks.
meanings.sent4: The politician tried to snoose the voters with false promises.
meanings.sent5: The spider snoosed the fly in its sticky web.
